t: Amos 1

The*p words of Amos, who was one of the sheep breeders from Tekoa- what he saw regarding Israel in the days of King Uzziah of Judah and Jeroboam son of Jehoash, king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
He*p said: The*pn Lord*s roars from Zion and*ln makes his voice heard from Jerusalem; the*ln pastures of the shepherds mourn, and*ln the summit of Carmel withers.
Judgment on Israel’s Neighbors
The*p Lord*s says: I*pn will not relent from punishing Damascus for*ln three crimes, even four, because*ln they threshed Gilead with iron sledges.
Therefore,*ln I will send fire against Hazael’s palace, and*ln it will consume Ben-hadad’s citadels.

I*ln will break down the gates of Damascus. I*ln will cut off the ruler from the Valley of Aven, and*ln the one who wields the scepter from Beth-eden. The*ln people of Aram will be exiled to Kir. The*ln Lord*s has spoken.
The*p Lord*s says: I*pn will not relent from punishing Gaza for*ln three crimes, even four, because*ln they exiled a whole community, handing*ln them over to Edom.
Therefore,*ln I will send fire against the walls of Gaza, and*ln it will consume its citadels.

I*ln will cut off the ruler from Ashdod, and*ln the one who wields the scepter from Ashkelon. I*ln will also turn my hand against Ekron, and*ln the remainder of the Philistines will perish. The*ln Lord God*s has spoken.
The*p Lord*s says: I*pn will not relent from punishing Tyre for*ln three crimes, even four, because*ln they handed over a*ln whole community of exiles to Edom and*ln broke a treaty of brotherhood.
Therefore,*ln I will send fire against the walls of Tyre, and*ln it will consume its citadels.

The*p Lord*s says: I*pn will not relent from punishing Edom for*ln three crimes, even four, because*ln he pursued his brother with the sword. He*ln stifled his compassion, his*ln anger tore at him continually, and*ln he harbored his rage incessantly.
Therefore,*ln I will send fire against Teman, and*ln it will consume the citadels of Bozrah.

The*p Lord*s says: I*pn will not relent from punishing the Ammonites for*ln three crimes, even four, because*ln they ripped open the*ln pregnant women of Gilead in*ln order to enlarge their territory.
Therefore,*ln I will set fire to the walls of Rabbah, and*ln it will consume its citadels. There*ln will be shouting on the day of battle and*ln a violent wind on the day of the storm.
Their*ln king and his princes will*ln go into exile together. The*ln Lord*s has spoken.
Amos 2
The*p Lord*s says: I*pn will not relent from punishing Moab for*ln three crimes, even four, because*ln he burned the bones of*ln the king of Edom to lime.
Therefore,*ln I will send fire against Moab, and*ln it will consume the citadels of Kerioth. Moab*ln will die with a tumult, with*ln shouting and the sound of the ram’s horn.
I*ln will cut off the judge from the land and*ln kill all its officials with him. The*ln Lord*s has spoken.
Judgment on Judah

The*p Lord*s says: I*pn will not relent from punishing Judah for*ln three crimes, even four, because*ln they have rejected the instruction of the Lord*s and*ln have not kept his statutes. The*ln lies that their ancestors followed have*ln led them astray.
Therefore,*ln I will send fire against Judah, and*ln it will consume the citadels of Jerusalem.
Judgment on Israel
The*p Lord*s says: I*pn will not relent from punishing Israel for*ln three crimes, even four, because*ln they sell a righteous person for silver and*ln a needy person for a pair of sandals.

They*ln trample the heads of the poor on*ln the dust of the ground and*ln obstruct the path of the needy. A*ln man and his father have sexual relations with*ln the same girl, profaning*ln my holy name.
They*ln stretch out beside every altar on*ln garments taken as collateral, and*ln in the house of their God they*ln drink wine obtained through fines.
Yet*pn I destroyed the Amorite as Israel advanced; his*ln height was like the cedars, and*ln he was as sturdy as the oaks; I*ln destroyed his fruit above and his roots beneath.
And*ln I brought you from the land of Egypt and*ln led you forty years in the wilderness in*ln order to possess the land of the Amorite.
I*ln raised up some of your sons as prophets and*ln some of your young men as Nazirites. Is*ln this not the case, Israelites? This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
But*pn you made the Nazirites drink wine and*ln commanded the prophets, “Do*ln not prophesy.”
Look,*ln I am about to crush you in your place as*ln a wagon crushes when full of grain.
Escape*ln will fail the swift, the*ln strong one will not maintain his strength, and*ln the warrior will not save his life.
The*ln archer will not stand his ground, the*ln one who is swift of foot will*ln not save himself, and*ln the one riding a horse will not save his life.
Even*ln the most courageous of the warriors will*ln flee naked on that day— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Amos 3
God’s Reasons for Punishing Israel
Listen*p to this message that the Lord*s has spoken against you, Israelites, against the entire clan that I brought from the land of Egypt:
I*pn have known only you out*ln of all the clans of the earth; therefore,*ln I will punish you for all your iniquities.
Can*ln two walk together without*ln agreeing to meet?
Does*ln a lion roar in the forest when*ln it has no prey? Does*ln a young lion growl from its lair unless*ln it has captured something?
Does*ln a bird land in a trap on the ground if*ln there is no bait for it? Does*ln a trap spring from the ground when*ln it has caught nothing?
If*ln a ram’s horn is blown in a city, aren’t*ln people afraid? If*ln a disaster occurs in a city, hasn’t*ln the Lord*s done it?
Indeed,*ln the Lord God*s does nothing without*ln revealing his counsel to*ln his servants the prophets.
A*ln lion has roared; who*ln will not fear? The*ln Lord God*s has spoken; who*ln will not prophesy?

Proclaim*pn on the citadels in Ashdod and*ln on the citadels in the land of Egypt: Assemble*ln on the mountains of Samaria, and*ln see the great turmoil in the city and*ln the acts of oppression within it.
The*ln people are incapable of doing right— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — those*pn who store up violence and destruction in*ln their citadels.
Therefore,*p the Lord God*s says: An*pn enemy will surround the land; he*ln will destroy your strongholds and*ln plunder your citadels.

The*p Lord*s says: As*pn the shepherd snatches two legs or*ln a piece of an ear from*ln the lion’s mouth, so*ln the Israelites who live in Samaria will*ln be rescued with*ln only the corner of a bed or*ln the cushion of a couch.
Listen*pn and testify against the house of Jacob — this*lg is the declaration of the Lord God,*s the*lg God of Armies.
I*pn will punish the altars of Bethel on*ln the day I punish Israel for its crimes; the*ln horns of the altar will be cut off and*ln fall to the ground.
I*ln will demolish the winter house and*ln the summer house; the*ln houses inlaid with ivory will be destroyed, and*ln the great houses will come to an end. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Amos 4
Social and Spiritual Corruption
Listen*pn to this message, you cows of Bashan who*ln are on the hill of Samaria, women*ln who oppress the poor and*ln crush the needy, who*ln say to their husbands, “Bring*ln us something to drink.”
The*p Lord God*s has sworn by his holiness: Look,*pn the days are coming when*ln you will be taken away with hooks, every*ln last one of you with fishhooks.
You*ln will go through breaches in the wall, each*ln woman straight ahead, and*ln you will be driven along toward Harmon. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Come*pn to Bethel and rebel; rebel*ln even more at Gilgal! Bring*ln your sacrifices every morning, your*ln tenths every three days.
Offer*ln leavened bread as a thanksgiving sacrifice, and*ln loudly proclaim your freewill offerings, for*ln that is what you Israelites love to do! This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God.*s
God’s Discipline and Israel’s Apostasy
I*pn gave you absolutely nothing to eat in all your cities, a*ln shortage of food in all your communities, yet*ln you did not return to me. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.

I*pn also withheld the rain from you while*ln there were still three months until harvest. I*ln sent rain on one city but*ln no rain on another. One*ln field received rain while*ln a field with no rain withered.
Two*ln or three cities staggered to*ln another city to drink water but*ln were not satisfied, yet*ln you did not return to me. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.

I*pn struck you with blight and mildew; the*ln locust devoured your*ln many gardens and vineyards, your*ln fig trees and olive trees, yet*ln you did not return to me. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.

I*pn sent plagues like those of Egypt; I*ln killed your young men with the sword, along*ln with your captured horses. I*ln caused the stench of your camp to*ln fill your nostrils, yet*ln you did not return to me. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
I*pn overthrew some of you as*ln I overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and*ln you were like a burning stick snatched*ln from a fire, yet*ln you did not return to me— This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Therefore,*pn Israel, that is what I will do to you, and*ln since I will do that to you, Israel,*ln prepare to meet your God!

He*ln is here: the*ln one who forms the mountains, creates*ln the wind, and*ln reveals his thoughts to man, the*ln one who makes the dawn out of darkness and*ln strides on the heights of the earth. The*ln Lord,*s the God of Armies, is his name.
Amos 5
Lamentation for Israel
Listen*p to this message that I am singing for you, a lament, house of Israel:
She*pn has fallen; Virgin*ln Israel will never rise again. She*ln lies abandoned on her land with*ln no one to raise her up.

For*p the Lord God*s says: The*pn city that marches out a thousand strong will*ln have only a hundred left, and*ln the one that marches out a hundred strong will*ln have only ten left in the house of Israel.
Seek God and Live
For*p the Lord*s says to the house of Israel: Seek*pn me and live!
Do*ln not seek Bethel or*ln go to Gilgal or*ln journey to Beer-sheba, for*ln Gilgal will certainly go into exile, and*ln Bethel will come to nothing.
Seek*ln the Lord*s and live, or*ln he will spread like fire throughout*ln the house of Joseph; it*ln will consume everything with*ln no one at Bethel to extinguish it.
Those*ln who turn justice into wormwood also*ln throw righteousness to the ground.

The*pn one who made the Pleiades and Orion, who*ln turns darkness into dawn and*ln darkens day into night, who*ln summons the water of the sea and*ln pours it out over the surface of the earth— the*ln Lord*s is his name.
He*ln brings destruction on the strong, and*ln it falls on the fortress.
They*pn hate the one who convicts the guilty at*ln the city gate, and*ln they despise the one who speaks with integrity.

Therefore,*ln because you trample on the poor and*ln exact a grain tax from him, you*ln will never live in the houses of cut stone you*ln have built; you*ln will never drink the wine from*ln the lush vineyards you*ln have planted.
For*ln I know your crimes are many and*ln your sins innumerable. They*ln oppress the righteous, take a bribe, and*ln deprive the poor of justice at the city gates.
Therefore,*ln those who have insight will keep silent at*ln such a time, for*ln the days are evil.
Pursue*pn good and not evil so*ln that you may live, and*ln the Lord,*s the God of Armies, will*ln be with you as*ln you have claimed.
Hate*ln evil and love good; establish*ln justice at the city gate. Perhaps*ln the Lord,*s the God of Armies, will be gracious to*ln the remnant of Joseph.

Therefore*p the Lord,*s the God of Armies, the Lord, says: There*pn will be wailing in all the public squares; they*ln will cry out in anguish in all the streets. The*ln farmer will be called on to mourn, and*ln professional mourners to wail.
There*ln will be wailing in all the vineyards, for*ln I will pass among you. The*ln Lord*s has spoken.
The Day of the Lord
Woe*pn to you who long for the day of the Lord!*s What*ln will the day of the Lord*s be for you? It*ln will be darkness and not light.
It*ln will be like a man who flees from a lion only*ln to have a bear confront him. He*ln goes home and rests his hand against the wall only*ln to have a snake bite him.
Won’t*ln the day of the Lord*s be*ln darkness rather than light, even*ln gloom without any brightness in it?
I*ln hate, I despise, your feasts! I*ln can’t stand the stench of*ln your solemn assemblies.
Even*ln if you offer me your*ln burnt offerings and grain offerings, I*ln will not accept them; I*ln will have no regard for*ln your fellowship offerings of fattened cattle.
Take*ln away from me the noise of your songs! I*ln will not listen to the music of your harps.
But*ln let justice flow like water, and*ln righteousness, like an unfailing stream.
“House*p of Israel, was it sacrifices and grain offerings that you presented to me during the forty years in the wilderness?
But you have taken up Sakkuth your king and Kaiwan your star god, images you have made for yourselves.
So I will send you into exile beyond Damascus.” The Lord,*s the God of Armies, is his name. He has spoken.
Amos 6
Woe to the Complacent
Woe*pn to those who are at ease in Zion and*ln to those who feel secure on the hill of Samaria — the*ln notable people in this first of the nations, those*ln the house of Israel comes to.
Cross*ln over to Calneh and see; go*ln from there to great Hamath; then*ln go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are*ln you better than these kingdoms? Is*ln their territory larger than yours?
You*ln dismiss any thought of the evil day and*ln bring in a reign of violence.
They*pn lie on beds inlaid with ivory, sprawled*ln out on their couches, and*ln dine on lambs from the flock and*ln calves from the stall.
They*ln improvise songs to the sound of the harp and*ln invent their own musical instruments like David.
They*ln drink wine by the bowlful and*ln anoint themselves with the finest oils but*ln do not grieve over the ruin of Joseph.
Therefore,*ln they will now go into exile as*ln the first of the captives, and*ln the feasting of those who sprawl out will*ln come to an end.
Israel’s Pride Judged

The*p Lord God*s has sworn by himself- this is the declaration of the Lord,*s the God of Armies: I*pn loathe Jacob’s pride and*ln hate his citadels, so*ln I will hand over the city and everything in it.
And*p if there are ten men left in one house, they will die.

A close relative and burner will remove his corpse from the house. He will call to someone in the inner recesses of the house, “Any more with you?” That*p person will reply, “None.” Then*p he will say, “Silence, because the Lord’s*s name must not be invoked.”
For*p the Lord*s commands: The*pn large house will be smashed to pieces, and*ln the small house to rubble.
Do*pn horses gallop on the cliffs? Does*ln anyone plow there with oxen? Yet*ln you have turned justice into poison and*ln the fruit of righteousness into wormwood—
you*ln who rejoice over Lo-debar and*ln say, “Didn’t we capture Karnaim for*ln ourselves by our own strength?”

But*ln look, I am raising up a nation against*ln you, house of Israel— this*lg is the declaration of the Lord, the*lg God*s of Armies — and*pn they will oppress you from*ln the entrance of Hamath to*ln the Brook of the Arabah.
Amos 7
First Vision: Locusts
The*p Lord God*s showed me this: He was forming a swarm of locusts at the time the spring crop first began to sprout - after the cutting of the king’s hay.
When the locusts finished eating the vegetation of the land, I said, “Lord God,*s please forgive! How will Jacob survive since he is so small?”
The*p Lord*s relented concerning this. “It will not happen,” he said.
Second Vision: Fire
The*p Lord God*s showed me this: The Lord God*s was calling for a judgment by fire. It consumed the great deep and devoured the land.
Then I said, “Lord God,*s please stop! How will Jacob survive since he is so small?”
The*p Lord*s relented concerning this. “This will not happen either,” said the Lord God.*s
Third Vision: A Plumb Line
He*p showed me this: The Lord was standing there by a vertical wall with a plumb line in his hand.
The Lord*s asked me, “What do you see, Amos?” I*p replied, “A plumb line.” Then*p the Lord said, “I am setting a plumb line among my people Israel; I will no longer spare them:
Isaac’s*pn high places will be deserted, and*ln Israel’s sanctuaries will be in ruins; I*ln will rise up against the house of Jeroboam with*ln a sword.”
Amaziah’s Opposition
Amaziah*p the priest of Bethel sent word to King Jeroboam of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you right here in the house of Israel. The land cannot endure all his words,
for Amos has said this: ‘Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel will certainly go into exile from its homeland.’”
Then*p Amaziah said to Amos, “Go away, you seer! Flee to the land of Judah. Earn your living and give your prophecies there,
but don’t ever prophesy at Bethel again, for it is the king’s sanctuary and a royal temple.”
So*p Amos answered Amaziah, “I was not a prophet or the son of a prophet; rather, I was a herdsman, and I took care of sycamore figs.
But the Lord*s took me from following the flock and said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to my people Israel.’”
Now*p hear the word of the Lord.*s You say: Do*pn not prophesy against Israel; do*ln not preach against the house of Isaac.

Therefore,*p this is what the Lord*s says: Your*pn wife will be a prostitute in the city, your*ln sons and daughters will fall by the sword, and*ln your land will be divided up with*ln a measuring line. You*ln yourself will die on pagan soil, and*ln Israel will certainly go into exile from*ln its homeland.
Amos 8
Fourth Vision: A Basket of Summer Fruit
The*p Lord God*s showed me this: a basket of summer fruit.
He asked me, “What do you see, Amos?” I*p replied, “A basket of summer fruit.” The*p Lord*s said to me, “The end has come for my people Israel; I will no longer spare them.
In that day the temple songs will become wailing”- this is the Lord God’s*s declaration. “Many dead bodies, thrown everywhere! Silence!”
Hear*pn this, you who trample on the needy and*ln do away with the poor of the land,

asking,*ln “When will the New Moon be over so*ln we may sell grain, and*ln the Sabbath, so*ln we may market wheat? We*ln can reduce the measure while*ln increasing the price and*ln cheat with dishonest scales.
We*ln can buy the poor with silver and*ln the needy for a pair of sandals and*ln even sell the chaff!”
The*p Lord*s has sworn by the Pride of Jacob: I*pn will never forget all their deeds.
Because*ln of this, won’t the land quake and*ln all who dwell in it mourn? All*ln of it will rise like the Nile; it*ln will surge and then subside like*ln the Nile in Egypt.
And*pn in that day — this*lg is the declaration of the Lord God—*s I*pn will make the sun go down at noon; I*ln will darken the land in the daytime.

I*ln will turn your feasts into mourning and*ln all your songs into lamentation; I*ln will cause everyone to wear sackcloth and*ln every head to be shaved. I*ln will make that grief like*ln mourning for an only son and*ln its outcome like a bitter day.

Look,*pn the days are coming — this*lg is the declaration of the Lord God—*s when*pn I will send a famine through the land: not*ln a famine of bread or a thirst for water, but*ln of hearing the words of the Lord.*s
People*ln will stagger from sea to sea and*ln roam from north to east seeking*ln the word of the Lord,*s but*ln they will not find it.
In*ln that day the beautiful young women, the*ln young men also, will faint from thirst.
Those*ln who swear by the guilt of Samaria and*ln say, “As your god lives, Dan,” or,*ln “As the way of Beer-sheba lives”— they*ln will fall, never to rise again.
Amos 9
Fifth Vision: The Lord beside the Altar

I*p saw the Lord standing beside the altar, and he said: Strike*pn the capitals of the pillars so*ln that the thresholds shake; knock*ln them down on the heads of all the people. Then*ln I will kill the rest of them with the sword. None*ln of those who flee will get away; none*ln of the fugitives will escape.
If*ln they dig down to Sheol, from*ln there my hand will take them; if*ln they climb up to heaven, from*ln there I will bring them down.

If*ln they hide on*ln the top of Carmel, from*ln there I will track them down and*ln seize them; if*ln they conceal themselves from*ln my sight on the sea floor, from*ln there I will command the*ln sea serpent to bite them.
And*ln if they are driven by*ln their enemies into captivity, from*ln there I will command the*ln sword to kill them. I*ln will keep my eye on them for*ln harm and not for good.
The*pn Lord, the God*s of Armies — he*ln touches the earth; it*ln melts, and all who dwell in it mourn; all*ln of it rises like the Nile and*ln subsides like the Nile of Egypt.

He*ln builds his upper chambers in*ln the heavens and*ln lays the foundation of his vault on*ln the earth. He*ln summons the water of the sea and*ln pours it out over the surface of the earth. The*ln Lord*s is his name.
Announcement of Judgment

Israelites,*pn are you not like the Cushites to me? This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. Didn’t*pn I bring Israel from the land of Egypt, the*ln Philistines from Caphtor, and*ln the Arameans from Kir?

Look,*ln the eyes of the Lord God*s are*ln on the sinful kingdom, and*ln I will obliterate it from*ln the face of the earth. However,*ln I will not totally destroy the*ln house of Jacob— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration —
for*pn I am about to give the command, and*ln I will shake the house of Israel among*ln all the nations, as*ln one shakes a sieve, but*ln not a pebble will fall to the ground.
All*ln the sinners among my people who*ln say, “Disaster will never overtake or*ln confront us,” will*ln die by the sword.
Announcement of Restoration
In*pn that day I*ln will restore the fallen shelter of David: I*ln will repair its gaps, restore*ln its ruins, and*ln rebuild it as in the days of old,
so*ln that they may possess the*ln remnant of Edom and*ln all the nations that*ln bear my name— this*lg is the declaration of the Lord;*s he will do this.

Look,*pn the days are coming — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — when*pn the plowman will overtake the reaper and*ln the one who treads grapes, the*ln sower of seed. The*ln mountains will drip with sweet wine, and*ln all the hills will flow with it.
I*ln will restore the fortunes of my people Israel. They*ln will rebuild and occupy ruined cities, plant*ln vineyards and drink their wine, make*ln gardens and eat their produce.
I*ln will plant them on their land, and*ln they will never again be uprooted from*ln the land I have given them. The*ln Lord*s your God has spoken.
